item.title: stephanie add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: stephanie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and they’ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back." -- John Green

item.title: stephanie add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Memory believes before knowing remembers. Believes longer than recollects, longer than knowing even wonders." -- William Faulkner

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "The best moments in reading are when you come across something - a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things - which you had thought special and particular to you. And now, here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has come out, and taken yours" -- Alan Bennett

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Jay Asher
item.description: "You don’t know what goes on in anyone’s life but your own. And when you mess with one part of a person’s life, you’re not messing with just that part. Unfortunately, you can’t be that precise and selective. When you mess with one part of a person’s life, you’re messing with their entire life. Everything. . . affects everything." -- Jay Asher

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Maureen Johnson
item.description: "Writing is one of the few careers for which you essentially train yourself, the other two major ones being juggling and pickpocketing." -- Maureen Johnson

item.title: stephanie add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Read, read, read. Read everything -- trash, classics, good and bad, and see how they do it. Just like a carpenter who works as an apprentice and studies the master. Read! You'll absorb it. Then write. If it's good, you'll find out. If it's not, throw it out of the window." -- William Faulkner

item.title: stephanie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Francois Rabelais. He was a poet. And his last words were "I go to seek a Great Perhaps." That's why I'm going. So I don't have to wait until I die to start seeking a Great Perhaps." -- John Green

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Tess Gerritsen
item.description: "I know there’s evil in the world, and there always has been. But you don’t need to believe in Satan or demons to explain it. Human beings are perfectly capable of evil all by themselves." -- Tess Gerritsen

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: stephanie add a quote by David Levithan
item.description: "i think the idea of a 'mental health day' is something completely invented by people who have no clue what it's like to have bad mental health. the idea that your mind can be aired out in twenty-four hours is kind of like saying heart disease can be cured if you eat the right breakfast cereal. mental health days only exist for people who have the luxury of saying 'i don't want to deal with things today' and then can take the whole day off, while the rest of us are stuck fighting the fights we always fight, with no one really caring one way or another, unless we choose to bring a gun to school or ruin the morning announcements with a suicide." -- David Levithan

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "Maybe she'd always been there. Maybe strangers enter your heart first and then you spent the rest of your life searching for them. " -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "Comfort zones are overrated. They make you lazy." -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "You don't die. You just... get really angry and then after you're angry you hurt a lot and then the best thing is that one day you remember something she said or did and you laugh instead of crying." -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Melina Marchetta
item.description: "Be prepared for the worst, my love, for it lives next door to the best." -- Melina Marchetta

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Cut off as I am, it is inevitable that I should sometimes feel like a shadow walking in a shadowy world. When this happens I ask to be taken to New York City. Always I return home weary but I have the comforting certainty that mankind is real flesh and I myself am not a dream." -- Helen Keller

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "A book, too, can be a star, a living fire to lighten the darkness, leading out into the expanding universe." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Believing takes practice." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "We don't want to feel less when we have finished a book; we want to feel that new possibilities of being have been opened to us. We don't want to close a book with a sense that life is totally unfair and that there is no light in the darkness; we want to feel that we have been given illumination." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Elizabeth C. Bunce
item.description: "For a moment I was distracted. Books always did that to me... I liked the creamy pages, the smell of ink, all the secrets locked inside." -- Elizabeth C. Bunce

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Stephen Dunn
item.description: "I will try to disappoint you better than anyone ever has." -- Stephen Dunn

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Laura Lippman
item.description: "Reading was not a fallback position for her but an ideal state of being." -- Laura Lippman

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "It is a do-it-yourself era: health care, real estate, police investigation. Go online and f*ing figure it out for yourself because everyone’s overworked and understaffed." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "It's like being in love, discovering your best friend." -- Elizabeth Wein

item.title: stephanie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "We are all going, I thought, and it applies to turtles and turtlenecks, Alaska the girl and Alaska the place, because nothing can last, not even the earth itself. The Buddha said that suffering was caused by desire, we'd learned, and that the cessation of desire meant the cessation of suffering. When you stopped wishing things wouldn't fall apart, you'd stop suffering when they did." -- John Green

item.title: stephanie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "But ultimately I do not believe that she was only matter. The rest of her must be recycled, too. I believe now that we are greater than the sum of our parts. If you take Alaska's genetic code and you add her life experiences and the relationships she had with people, and then you take the size and shape of her body, you do not get her. There is something else entirely. There is a part of her greater than the sum of her knowable parts. And that part has to go somewhere, because it cannot be destroyed" -- John Green

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "I used to sleep with my books in piles all over my bed and sometimes they were the only thing keeping me warm and always the only thing keeping me alive. Books are the best and worst defense." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: stephanie add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "It's where we're nearest to our humanness. Useless knowledge for its own sake. Useful knowledge is good, too, but it's for the faint-hearted, an elaboration of the real thing, which is only to shine some light, it doesn't matter where on what, it's the light itself, against the darkness, it's what's left of God's purpose when you take away God." -- Tom Stoppard
